import React from "react"; import "./style.css"; import "../../../box-style.css"; import StoryBox from "./StoryBox" export default function About() { return (
 

About Me

{/* */}

For the last five years I've been working as a freelance illustrator, working on children's books, comics, infographics and more. While I still love to draw, I realised I didn't want to do it as a career, and started looking for a change. That's when I found the School of Code.

I'd dabbled in small coding projects in the past, mostly HTML and CSS with a tiny bit of vanilla javascript thrown in for good luck, and while had always found it fascinating, it felt inaccessable and hard to get into. The vast majority of people I saw working in tech were middle class men, and I didn't feel like I would necessarily fit in with the culture I imagined it to be.{" "}

Thanks to some incredible role models, including woman and many non binary people, I've discovered that my initial analisis of the culture of tech couldn't be further from the truth, and there is absolutely a place for me here - and what's more, people like me are needed in the industry!

A New Start, in Troubling Times...

When Covid19 first started trickling into public knowledge, I had just finished a large scale project which had me questioning whether freelancing was te right place for me. I've always been passionate about creativity and storytelling, but working for myself, on my own, left me feeling like something was missing. Then lockdown began, and my illustration work dried up, I started looking for other options. The answer had been staring at me in the face the whole time.

And that answer was, quite obviously, work in tech! An ever growing, constantly developing, always in demand industry that required its workforce to be creative, problem solving, future-thinking, fast learners?{" "} Sign me the heck up!

My 16 week bootcamp was fully remote, working alongside 47 other cohorts over Zoom, using slack, github, and other tools to collaborate and solve problems together every single day. I'm prepared for a post-covid working environment, am an expert at self-directed learning, have the skills to hit the ground running.

Where do I go from here?

The greatest thing about working in tech is the idea that nothing is ever certain. Nothing is set in stone. One week is not like the next week, and there is always something new to learn.

); }
